      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns a specific Relation.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.passToNextNodeA(@NonNull NodeList nodes)
      Removes this relation from the current node A and passes it on to the next one in the list.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.passToNextNodeB(@NonNull NodeList nodes)
      Does exactly the same as passToNextNodeA(NodeList), but with node B.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setName(java.lang.String name) 
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setNextNodeA(@NonNull NodeList nodes)
      Sets node A to the next node in the list of nodes.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setNextNodeB(@NonNull NodeList nodes)
      Sets node B to the next node in the nodes list.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setNextPlacement(Placement... placements)
      Sets the placement to the next in the list of placements.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setNodeA(Node node)
      Sets the starting node of this directional relation.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setNodeB(Node node) 
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setPlacement(@NonNull Placement placement)
      sets the placement of node A on node B.
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setRigid(boolean rigid) 
      @NonNull Relation Relation.setTemporaryFxOfNodeA(@NonNull FxWrapper fx)
      Sets the temporary FX of node A.
